Finally Cynthia entered a rather remote area of the forest completely devoid of humans. She saw lots of Pokemon; mostly insect-types but she did see a few Pikachu--which were super rare in Sinnoh.
It was approaching evening when Cynthia stumbled upon a rock in the middle of a small clearing. She almost fell to the ground but managed to grab a nearby tree and kept her balance. LOCATION: Pinwheel Forest

Sitting on a tree branch, Iris looked around, her companion Axew doing the same. They had entered the forest the night before to search for a mysterious Dragon-type Pokémon that had been sighted, but became side-tracked after a meteorite from the meteor shower had landed somewhere in the forest. To their luck, no other humans had entered the forest, meaning they could be the first ones to find it!

Looking down, Iris noticed a blue-skinned humanoid Pokémon. “Axew, look! A Sawk!” she exclaimed. “Those are rare around here!”

“Axew ew!” replied her friend, looking.

Iris pat his head. “It looks like it’s heading somewhere… Maybe it’s looking for that meteorite like we are!” She continued watching the Karate Pokémon.

Sawk, not knowing of the trainer’s presence, began walking away, towards a small clearing with several large patches of grass. Iris followed, leaping from branch to branch. Axew stayed in her hair, careful to not fall out during the jumps. As the Fighting-type calmly ventured into the clearing, Iris jumped down and landed on the ground with a quiet thud, trying not to attract its attention.

Sawk walked over to one of the patches and parted the grass. A faint glow emanated from it, catching Iris’s attention. She slowly snuck up to the Pokémon, wondering what the glow was. It bent over and picked up a large glowing rock. Iris gasped in surprise. “It’s the meteorite!” she yelled aloud.

The Sawk turned around, startled. “Meep!” squeaked Iris, covering her mouth. “Me and my big mouth!”

Before either of them could do anything, however, the meteorite in Sawk’s began to glow. It grunted in a mix of pain and ecstasy, dropping the rock. Iris, unsure of what to do, watched, a bead of sweat rolling down her cheek.
